top_categories.workout_context: Gravel del Fuego rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Gravel del Fuego’s chilean patagonia, south american gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 100 miles, Gravel del Fuego punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel del Fuego when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Gravel del Fuego isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel del Fuego. Make this intensity feel like home.
Gravel del Fuego’s patagonian mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Gravel del Fuego intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Gravel del Fuego’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel del Fuego — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Gravel del Fuego — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
At 100 miles, Gravel del Fuego rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel del Fuego’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel del Fuego. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel del Fuego requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on patagonian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: chilean patagonia, south american gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 100 miles of patagonian mountain gravel in Patagonia, Chile.
